stem: The patient is exhibiting signs of increased intracranial pressure (ICP). Select the nursing intervention that is MOST appropriate for this patient. Maintain the head of the bed at 30 degrees to promote _____ drainage and reduce ICP.

rationale.correct: Venous drainage is enhanced by elevating the head of the bed. This reduces ICP by facilitating the outflow of blood from the brain.

mnemonic.name: ELEVATE
mnemonic.description: Elevate Head of Bed, Limit Neck Flexion, Evaluate ICP, Vitals Monitor, Administer Medications, Teach Family, Ensure Safety

rationale.incorrect: CSF drainage is influenced by body positioning, but elevating the head of the bed primarily facilitates venous drainage in reducing ICP.

questionTrap.distractors: The distractors focus on other types of drainage that are less relevant to the immediate goal of reducing ICP through improved venous outflow.

clinicalPearls: Maintaining the head of the bed at 30 degrees is a standard intervention for patients with increased ICP.
Avoid extreme neck flexion or rotation, as this can impede venous drainage.
Monitor ICP closely and adjust interventions based on the patient's response.

itemContext.sbar: Patient is a 62-year-old male admitted for subarachnoid hemorrhage. Currently intubated and mechanically ventilated. BP is elevated. GCS is fluctuating. Pupils are sluggishly reactive to light. Physician notified of changes.

patient.relevantHistory: History of hypertension, currently intubated and mechanically ventilated.
